topic.para: This guide describes the setup of a minimal &ha; cluster with the following properties:

listitem.para: Three cluster nodes. Three nodes are required for this setup so that diskless &sbd; can handle split-brain scenarios without the help of &qdevice;.
A floating, virtual IP address that allows clients to connect to a service no matter which node the service is running on. This IP address is used to connect to the graphical management tool &hawk;.
Diskless &sbd; (&sbd.long;) and a software watchdog used as the node fencing mechanism to avoid split-brain scenarios.
Failover of resources from one node to another if the active host breaks down (active/passive setup).

topic.para: This is the simplest supported cluster setup with the fewest external requirements. You can use this cluster for testing purposes or as a minimal cluster configuration that you can extend later. Before using the cluster in a production environment, modify the cluster according to your requirements.
